intro: Sida trichoda, commonly known as the hairy sida, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in racemes. Its hairy stems and leaves are notable features, contributing to its common name. Sida trichoda is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields.
